result.execSummary:
The defendant Ben Richard Bosworth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 75 days.

miscConds.notes: Restitution joint and several with Bradley Wallace, Jimera Morgan and LaTonya Jennings in the amount of $6413.19 to Capital Credit Union, $2850 to Bay Lake Bank, $5614.14 to Associated Bank, $2803.80 to Bank Mutual, and $7105.40 to BMO Harris.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: 
Pay DNA surcharge, no other court costs are assessed to allow defendant to pay the restitution
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all DNA surcharge and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearms or body armor.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

No new violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Bradley Wallace, Jimera Morgan, LaTonya Jennings, Curtis Caffrey.
No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol or contact with the drug community.

Cooperate with probation department.
Provide a DNA sample.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: CONCURRENT to Count 1 and consecutive to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
As to Count 1: the Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  4 YEARS with 75 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
As to Count 2: the Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2 YEARS CONCURRENT to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.
These sentences are consecutive to any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 4 YEARS probation.
Court finds defendant ISeligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
- No new violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the probation department
- 50 hours of community service
- No contact with Bradley Wallace, Jimera Morgan, LaTonya Jennings, Curtis Caffrey
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol or contact with the drug community
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment and/or school
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution joint and several with Bradley Wallace, Jimera Morgan and LaTonya Jennings in the amount of $6413.19 to Capital Credit Union, $2850 to Bay Lake Bank, $5614.14 to Associated Bank, $2803.80 to Bank Mutual, and $7105.40 to BMO Harris; 
Pay DNA surcharge, no other court costs are assessed to allow defendant to pay the restitution
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all DNA surcharge and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearms or body armour
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letter dated 8/30/2015 from the Sheriff's Department

Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    As to both Counts:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Ben Richard Bosworth not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for David Robles for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense has received an offer and needs time to review the offer with the defendant.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Ben Richard Bosworth not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations are still ongoing.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation. Case adjourned to Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY ORDER.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.  The Court sets bail at $250.00 CASH with TOT Justice Point for Supervision.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant missed court on 06/11/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 06/17/2015 at 1:30pm, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  
Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  
Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
UPON RELEASE FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth not in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-064

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/2/15 @ 1:30pm
